docs.snippet: Stottlemyre, 75, a former star pitcher for the Yankees, has been struggling with multiple myeloma since 2000.

headline.print_headline: Stottlemyre’s Health Is Said to Be Improving
headline.main: Mel Stottlemyre’s Health Is Said to Be Improving

docs.snippet: Twitter Inc has told potential acquirers it is seeking to conclude negotiations about selling itself by the time it reports third-quarter earnings on Oct. 27, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline.print_headline: Twitter to Conclude Sale Deliberations This Month-Sources
headline.main: Twitter to Conclude Sale Deliberations This Month-Sources

docs.snippet: Mahmoud Abou Zeid, known as Shawkan, has been in a Cairo prison for over three years. He has now received an International Press Freedom Award.

headline.print_headline: Jailed Photojournalist From Egypt Is Honored
headline.main: Jailed by Egypt, Honored for His Photojournalism

docs.snippet: A double-digit score for the anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany (AfD) in a Berlin city vote on Sunday would be seen around the world as the rebirth of the Nazis, the mayor of the German capital has warned.

headline.print_headline: Strong AfD Showing in Berlin Vote Would Be Seen as Nazi Rebirth: Mayor
headline.main: Strong AfD Showing in Berlin Vote Would Be Seen as Nazi Rebirth: Mayor

docs.snippet: The app, owned by Facebook, was shut down by a state criminal court when it did not hand over data requested by authorities. The order was overturned.

headline.print_headline: WhatsApp Is Briefly Shut Down in Brazil for a Third Time
headline.main: WhatsApp Is Briefly Shut Down in Brazil for a Third Time

docs.snippet: Uzbekistan's interim president, Shavkat Mirziyoyev, has been nominated to run in the country's Dec. 4 presidential election, the central election commission said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Interim Uzbek Leader Mirziyoyev to Run in Dec. 4 Presidential Election
headline.main: Interim Uzbek Leader Mirziyoyev to Run in Dec. 4 Presidential Election

docs.snippet: The Security Council vote condemning Israeli settlements, which the United States did not block, could force Israel’s prime minister to make a choice.

headline.print_headline: Israel Wonders if Netanyahu Will Have to Play His Hand
headline.main: Israel Wonders How Long Netanyahu Can Back Settlements and Two-State Solution

docs.snippet: A Hong Kong student activist who helped organize pro-democracy protests in the Chinese-ruled city in 2014 was detained on arrival in Thailand on Wednesday, immigration officials said, with his supporters accusing China of being behind the move.

headline.print_headline: Thailand Bars Entry to Teenage Hong Kong Activist Whose Supporters Blame China
headline.main: Thailand Bars Entry to Teenage Hong Kong Activist Whose Supporters Blame China

docs.snippet: In his final news conference on his last foreign trip as president, he argued for a foreign policy in which America continues to take on major global problems.

headline.print_headline: As Obama’s Tour Ends, He Says U.S. Influence Must Not
headline.main: As Obama’s Tour Ends, He Says U.S. Involvement Abroad Must Not

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, during trip to Lima, Peru, argues for America's continued leadership in addressing global problems; statement comes at end of global tour spent assuring leaders that President-elect Donald Trump will not abandon their alliances.

docs.snippet: Social media experts are advising high school seniors to create professional profiles on LinkedIn and draw them to the attention of college admissions officers.

headline.print_headline: Now on College Checklists: A LinkedIn Profile
headline.main: New Item on the College Admission Checklist: LinkedIn Profile
